lines.text: Didn't your mother warn you that you shouldn't go out into Central Park at night?
My mother was the reason you shouldn't go out into Central Park at night.
Who is that mouse anyway?
That's no mouse, that's my brother.
Good-bye, fake father! Good-bye, fake mother!
Good-bye, fake son!
[Stuart drives off in the toy car]
I'm gonna miss that boy.
I'm gonna miss that car.
He hates us.
We've never been hated before...
Now I know that fairy tales are real.

[From the top of the stairs]
Fairy tales are real? Oy, I think I'm gonna cough up a furball.
Gee George, you all done crying?
Yeah! Are you all done being a jerk?
No!
So, what do I call you?
Mom.
And Dad.
We haven't told you the best news of all.
You have a brother, named George.
What do I call him?
George.
How did that stupid mouse get in my sail?
He's not a stupid mouse!
You're right; He's a stupid rat!
You seem tense!
Tense? Oh, I'm - I'm way, way past tense
Well, maybe I could help. Can I scratch your ears? I could rub your tummy.
How'd you like to rub it from the INSIDE, mouse-boy?
I'm a little confused. I thought that's what you did with a pet.
A Pet? I am not your pet! I'm a cat, you're a mouse. You should be livin' in a hole. This is my family.
Can we share them?
Read my furry pink lips. "No!"
[Stuart is trapped in a washing machine which is filling up]
Turn if off!
Why would I turn it off? It's my favorite show.
Say good night... Tinkerbell.
[Snowbell gulps]
Hey, Smokey! His name is Snowbell!
[Smacks him off the tree with a branch]
AAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRGGHHHHHHHHHH!

[referring to Stuart]
I think he's grown a little since we've been here.
That's what happened to me. One summer, I just shot right up!
[Grandpa Spencer, dubious, stares at the diminutive Estelle]
I lied, okay? Welcome to Manhattan!
Aren't you gonna' run?
Why?
'cause you're a mouse.
I'm not just a mouse. I'm a member of this family.
A mouse with a pet cat?
[rolls over and laughs out loud, repeating that line over again]
I guess that's pretty funny!
Pretty funny? I'm gonna wet my fur! A MOUSE WITH A PET CAT!
[laughs hard more, and looks down at Snowbell, who is embarrassed]
Your new little master? Wait 'til the boys hear all about this!
Ah, the humiliation!
[to Stuart]
I'm going to kill you!
You think you could help me?
Consider it done.
Thank-you Mister Smokey sir, how could I ever think you?
Don't worry Tinkerbell, anytime.
Tinkerbell! Ha Ha, He called me Tinkerbell! You're a funny guy!
Yeah, whatever. HOUSE CATS, Sheesh!
Maybe we should go home.
Why?
I'm not wearing my lucky underwear.
You don't have lucky underwear.
Well, maybe we should get some, and then come back for another race.
Mr. and Mrs. Little, we try to discourage couples from adopting outside of their own... species. It rarely works out.
I can't believe I'm arguing with lunch.
Snow, where are you going?
Oh, I gotta yawn, stare at traffic, lick myself. And believe me, that could take hours if you do it right.
Is he going to be alright?
Well, a lad that size swallowing all that detergent. Amazingly, I think he's gonna be fine. Also, he's very clean.

[bragging on George's ship]
Gee George, what did you do, get that out of a cereal box? I'm glad you're here George, somebody's got to finish last.
I'm so happy! I... I feel 10 inches tall!
[when Snowbell spots Stuart lying in bed]
Are you cozy?
Yes, thanks. I'm quite comfortable.
All I've got to sleep on is a rag in the corner, you little rat!
You know, I'm not picky as long as it ain't meat loaf. That stuff gives me gas, something awful.
I'm sorry, it's meat loaf.
Oh well, beggars can't be choosers. Load me up and light a match!

[Monty tries to go into the kitchen, but Snowbell tries stopping him, so he won't see Stuart and possibly humiliate him]
No, Monty. Stop. You don't wonna do that.
Why? I eat from garbage cans, drink from public toilets. Like a little gas is gonna bother me.
[he walks through the cat door to the kitchen]
No, wait. Don't!
[while the alley cats are chasing Stuart in the roadster]
I hope he runs out of gas!
I hope you do!
Why don't you run to the back?
I can't help it! I have a nervous stomach!
And I have an empty stomach! Now, get that mouse!
George, have you seen Stuart?
He's down here with me.

[whispering out]
What are you doing to him?
Taxi! What does a mouse have to do to get a cab in this city?
How you doing? You must be Stuart.
Actually... I must be going.
[Gets back into his little car]
What's your hurry, Murray?
Yeah, where ya going, Murray - - Urm Stuart. What's his name?

[while Stuart is hugging Snowball]
Snow, what's he doing to your leg? I can't help to think that this is wrong.
What the hell's going on here?
Urrrrm... Listen, Smokey... I want to quit this whole thing off... okay?
Too late!
He's not just a mouse! He's... He's... he's family.
Oh yeah. ha ha ha... I can see the resemblence...
[laughs evilly]
